Dual View
Random Solved
Random Open

Define a sequence by ... and\[a_{n+1}=\lfloor(a_n+1/2)\rfloor\]for .... The difference ... is the ...th digit in the binary e...

title: Erdős Problem #484: Monochromatic Sums in Colorings
description: Prove ∃ c > 0 such that any k-coloring of {1,...,N} has at least cN integers representable as monochromatic sums. SOLVED: Erdős-Sárközy-Sós (1989) proved N/2 - O(N^{1-1/2^{k+1}}) even sums exist, with O(log N) for k=2.

title: Minimum Terms in Squared Polynomials
description: Let f(k) be the minimum number of terms in P(x)², where P ranges over polynomials with exactly k non-zero terms. Is f(k) → ∞ as k → ∞?

title: Erdős Problem #486: Logarithmic Density for Modular Avoidance Sets
description: For any choice of forbidden residue classes modulo each n, must the set of integers avoiding all forbidden classes have a logarithmic density?

title: LCM Triples in Dense Sets
description: Let A ⊆ ℕ have positive density. Must there exist distinct a, b, c ∈ A such that lcm(a,b) = c? YES - follows from Kleitman's 1971 theorem on union-free collections.

title: Erdős Problem #489: Gaps Between B-Free Numbers
description: For sparse A, does lim (1/x)Σ(b_{i+1}-b_i)² exist for A-free numbers B? OPEN in general; YES for squarefree numbers (Erdős).

title: Erdős Problem #490: Distinct Products of Two Sets
description: If A, B ⊆ {1,...,N} have all products ab distinct, is |A||B| ≪ N²/log N? SOLVED: YES (Szemerédi 1976). Optimal example achieves N²/(2 log N).

title: Erdős Problem #491: Characterization of Additive Functions
description: If f: ℕ → ℝ is additive and |f(n+1) - f(n)| < c for all n, then f(n) = c'·log(n) + O(1). Proved by Wirsing (1970).

title: Erdős Problem #492: Uniform Distribution Relative to a Fixed Sequence
description: Is f(αn) uniformly distributed in [0,1) for almost all α, where f is a generalized fractional part? DISPROVED by Schmidt (1969).

title: Erdős Problem #494: Set Determination from k-Sums
description: Given a finite set A in the complex plane and k >= 1, does the multiset of k-sums (sums of k distinct elements) together with |A| uniquely determine A? For k > 2, yes for sufficiently large |A|.

title: Erdős Problem #499: Diagonals of Doubly Stochastic Matrices
description: Does every n×n doubly stochastic matrix have a diagonal with product ≥ n^{-n}? YES, proved by Marcus-Minc (1962).

title: Erdős #501: Independent Sets for Outer Measure Families
description: For bounded sets A_x with outer measure < 1, must infinite independent sets exist? Answer depends on set-theoretic axioms!

title: Erdős Problem #504: Maximum Angle in Point Sets
description: Determine α_n, the supremum of angles α such that every n-point set in the plane contains three points forming an angle at least α.

title: Erdős Problem #509: Covering Polynomial Sublevel Sets with Discs
description: Can the sublevel set {z ∈ ℂ : |f(z)| ≤ 1} of a monic polynomial be covered by closed discs with total radius ≤ 2?

title: Erdős Problem #511: Bounded Components of Polynomial Lemniscates
description: For a monic polynomial f(z), is the number of connected components of {z : |f(z)| < 1} with diameter > c bounded independently of degree? NO - disproved by Pommerenke (1961).

title: Erdős Problem #512: Littlewood's Conjecture on Exponential Sums
description: For finite A ⊂ ℤ with |A| = N, is ∫₀¹ |∑_{n∈A} e(nθ)| dθ ≫ log N? SOLVED: YES (Konyagin 1981, McGehee-Pigno-Smith 1981).

title: Erdős Problem #514: Growth of Entire Functions Along Paths
description: For a transcendental entire function f(z), does there exist a path L such that |f(z)/z^n| → ∞ as z → ∞ along L for every n? Part 1 proved by Boas (unpublished); parts 2 and 3 remain open.

title: Erdős Problem #515: Path Integrals of Inverse Entire Functions
description: For transcendental entire f, does there exist a path C → ∞ such that ∫_C |f|^{-λ} dz < ∞ for ALL λ > 0? SOLVED: YES by Lewis-Rossi-Weitsman (1984).

title: Erdős Problem #516: Gap Series and the Minimum Modulus Problem
description: For entire functions with Fabry gaps (nₖ/k → ∞), is lim sup (log m(r))/(log M(r)) = 1? YES - proved by Fuchs (1963).

title: Erdős Problem #517: Lacunary Entire Functions and Value Distribution
description: Do entire functions with Fabry gaps (nₖ/k → ∞) assume every value infinitely often? The main conjecture is OPEN, but Biernacki proved the stronger Fejér gap case.

title: Erdős Problem #518: Monochromatic Path Covers
description: Can K_n with any two-coloring be covered by √n monochromatic paths of the same color? SOLVED: Yes (Pokrovskiy-Versteegen-Williams 2024).

title: Power Sums of Complex Numbers
description: Turán's power sum problem: For z₁,...,zₙ ∈ ℂ with z₁=1, is there an absolute c>0 such that max_k |∑zᵢᵏ| > c? YES (Atkinson 1961). Best known: c > 1/2 (Biró 2000). Optimal ≈ 0.7.

title: Erdős Problem #520: Rademacher Multiplicative Functions
description: For a Rademacher multiplicative function f, does there exist a constant c > 0 such that almost surely limsup (∑_{m≤N} f(m)) / √(N log log N) = c?

title: Erdős Problem #521: Real Roots of Random ±1 Polynomials
description: For random ±1 polynomials, is Rₙ/log n → 2/π almost surely? Erdős-Offord (1956) proved E[Rₙ] = (2/π + o(1))log n. Do (2024) proved a.s. limit 1/π for roots in [-1,1]. Full a.s. convergence remains OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #522: Random Polynomial Roots in the Unit Disk
description: For random polynomials with ±1 coefficients, does the number of roots in the unit disk converge to n/2 almost surely? Yakir (2021) proved convergence in probability.

title: Erdős Problem #523: Maximum of Random Polynomials on Unit Circle
description: For random ±1 polynomials, max_{|z|=1} |f(z)| = (C+o(1))√(n log n)? SOLVED: YES with C = 1 (Halász 1973).

title: Erdős Problem #525: Littlewood Polynomials and Minimum Modulus
description: For Littlewood polynomials (±1 coefficients), what is m(f) = min|f(z)| on |z|=1? SOLVED: m(f) = o(1) almost surely (Kashin 1987), m(f) ≈ n^{-1/2} (Konyagin 1994), exact distribution identified (Cook-Nguyen 2021).

title: Erdős Problem #526: Circle Coverage by Random Arcs (Dvoretzky's Problem)
description: Given arc lengths a_n → 0 with Σa_n = ∞, when do random arcs cover the unit circle with probability 1? Shepp (1972) proved the necessary and sufficient condition is Σ exp(a_1+...+a_n)/n² = ∞.

title: Erdős Problem #527: Convergence of Random Power Series on Unit Circle
description: For aₙ with ∑|aₙ|² = ∞ and |aₙ| = o(1/√n), does ∑ εₙaₙzⁿ converge for some |z| = 1 for almost all sign choices? SOLVED: YES, and the convergence set has Hausdorff dimension 1 (Michelen-Sawhney 2025).

title: Erdős Problem #528: Connective Constant for Self-Avoiding Walks
description: Let f(n,k) count n-step self-avoiding walks in ℤ^k. Determine C_k = lim f(n,k)^{1/n}. The limit EXISTS (Hammersley-Morton), bounds k ≤ C_k ≤ 2k-1, Kesten's asymptotic known, but exact closed forms remain OPEN.

title: Erdos Problem #529: Self-Avoiding Walk End-to-End Distance
description: Study the expected end-to-end distance d_k(n) of self-avoiding walks in Z^k. High dimensions (k >= 5) resolved with d_k(n) ~ sqrt(n). Lower dimensions remain open with conjectured anomalous exponents.

title: Erdős Problem #531: Folkman's Theorem - Monochromatic Subset Sums
description: Estimate F(k), the minimal N such that any 2-coloring of {1,...,N} has a k-element set with monochromatic subset sums. Lower bound: F(k) ≥ 2^{2^{k-1}/k}.

title: Erdős Problem #532: Hindman's Theorem (IP Sets)
description: If ℕ is finitely colored, must some color class be an IP set? Proved by Hindman (1974): YES, for any finite coloring there exists an infinite set A such that all finite subset sums of A are monochromatic.

title: Erdős Problem #534: Maximum GCD-Intersecting Sets
description: What is the largest subset A ⊆ {1,...,N} containing N such that gcd(a,b) > 1 for all distinct a,b ∈ A? Solved by Ahlswede-Khachatrian (1996) who proved the optimal sets use multiples of {2q₁,...,2qⱼ, q₁⋯qⱼ}.

title: Erdős Problem #535: GCD-Free r-Subsets
description: For r ≥ 3, estimate f_r(N): the maximum size of A ⊆ {1,...,N} with no r elements having equal pairwise gcds. Known: N^{1/2+o(1)} upper (Abbott-Hanson), N^{c/log log N} lower (Erdős). Gap remains open.

title: Erdős Problem #537: Three Numbers with Equal Prime Products
description: Let ε > 0 and N be large. If A ⊆ {1,...,N} has |A| ≥ εN, must there exist a₁,a₂,a₃ ∈ A and distinct primes p₁,p₂,p₃ with a₁p₁ = a₂p₂ = a₃p₃? NO, disproved by Ruzsa's counterexample.

title: Erdős Problem #539: GCD-Reduced Quotients
description: For A ⊆ ℕ of size n, what is the minimum size of { a/gcd(a,b) : a,b ∈ A }? Bounds: n^{1/2} ≪ h(n) ≪ n^{2/3}. Exact behavior unknown.

title: Erdős Problem #540: Zero-Sum Subsets (Erdős-Heilbronn Conjecture)
description: Is it true that if A ⊆ ℤ/Nℤ has size ≫ √N then there exists some non-empty S ⊆ A such that Σₛ∈S s ≡ 0 (mod N)?

title: Erdős Problem #541: Graham's Conjecture on Zero-Sum Subsequences
description: If a sequence of p residues modulo p has the property that all nonempty zero-sum subsets have the same cardinality r, must at most 2 distinct residues appear in the sequence? This was conjectured by Graham and proved by Erdős-Szemerédi (1976) for large primes, then by Gao-Hamidoune-Wang (2010) for all moduli.

title: Erdős #543: Random Subset Sums in Abelian Groups
description: What is the minimal size k such that a random k-subset of an abelian group spans all elements via subset sums with probability ≥ 1/2?

title: Erdős #545: Ramsey Numbers and Maximally Complete Graphs
description: Is the Ramsey number R(G) maximized when G is 'as complete as possible' for a given number of edges?

title: Erdős #546: Ramsey Numbers and Edge Count
description: For a graph G with no isolated vertices and m edges, is R(G) ≤ 2^{O(√m)}? Solved by Sudakov (2011). The ≥3 color version remains open.

title: Erdős Problem #547: Tree Ramsey Numbers
description: For any tree T on n vertices, R(T) ≤ 2n - 2. The bound is tight: stars achieve R(S_n) = 2n - 2.

title: Erdős Problem #548: The Erdős-Sós Conjecture
description: Every graph on n vertices with more than (k-1)n/2 edges contains every tree on k+1 vertices. This famous conjecture of Erdős and Sós remains open, with partial results for girth ≥ 5, C₄-free graphs, and large k.

title: Erdős Problem #549: Ramsey Numbers for Bipartite Trees
description: Conjecture: R(T) = 4k-1 for bipartite (k, 2k) trees. DISPROVED by Norin-Sun-Zhao! The double star has R(T) ≥ 4.2k. Best bounds: 4.2k ≤ R ≤ 4.21526k.

title: Erdős Problem #55: Ramsey r-Complete Sets
description: A set A is Ramsey r-complete if every r-coloring has a monochromatic subset whose sums cover all large integers. The optimal growth rate is Θ(r(log N)²).

title: Erdős #550: Ramsey Numbers for Trees and Multipartite Graphs
description: For T a tree on n vertices and G = K_{m₁,...,mₖ}, prove R(T,G) ≤ (χ(G)-1)(R(T,K_{m₁,m₂})-1)+m₁. Chvátal (1977): R(T,Kₘ) = (m-1)(n-1)+1 is the foundational result.

title: Erdős #551: Ramsey Numbers for Cycles vs Complete Graphs
description: Prove R(C_k, K_n) = (k-1)(n-1) + 1 for k ≥ n ≥ 3 (except n=k=3). Bondy-Erdős (1973): k > n²-2. Nikiforov (2005): k ≥ 4n+2. Keevash-Long-Skokan (2021): k ≥ C log n / log log n.

title: Erdős #552: Ramsey Number R(C₄, Sₙ)
description: Determine R(C₄, Sₙ) for the 4-cycle and star graph. Is R(C₄, Sₙ) ≤ n + √n - c for infinitely many n? Connected to prime gaps.

title: Erdős Problem #553: Multi-Color Ramsey Asymptotics
description: Show R(3,3,n)/R(3,n) → ∞. The third color dramatically increases the off-diagonal threshold. Solved by Alon-Rödl (2005): R(3,3,n) ≍ n³(log n)^O(1) vs R(3,n) ≪ n²/log n.

title: Erdős Problem #556: 3-Color Ramsey Number for Cycles
description: Show that R(C_n;3) ≤ 4n-3, where R(G;3) is the 3-color Ramsey number. PROVED: bound is tight for odd n (KSS 2005), and R(C_n;3) = 2n for even n (Benevides-Skokan 2009).

title: Erdős Problem #558: Multicolor Ramsey Numbers for Complete Bipartite Graphs
description: Determine R(K_{s,t}; k), the minimum m such that any k-coloring of K_m contains monochromatic K_{s,t}. Key results: R(K_{2,2}; k) ~ k², R(K_{3,3}; k) ~ k³.

title: Erdős Problem #559: Size Ramsey Numbers for Bounded Degree Graphs
description: Does R̂(G) ≪_d n for bounded-degree graphs G? DISPROVED for d ≥ 3 by Rödl-Szemerédi (2000). The size Ramsey number R̂(G) is the minimum edges m such that some graph H with m edges is Ramsey for G.

title: Erdős Problem #56: Weakly Divisible Sets
description: Is the set of multiples of the first k primes the largest subset of {1,...,N} with no k+1 pairwise coprime elements?

title: Erdos Problem #560: Size Ramsey Number of Complete Bipartite Graphs
description: Determine the size Ramsey number R_hat(K_{n,n}) - the minimum edges in a graph H such that any 2-coloring contains a monochromatic K_{n,n}. Known bounds: (1/60)n^2*2^n to (3/2)n^3*2^n.

title: Size Ramsey Numbers for Unions of Stars
description: For unions of stars F₁ = ∪_{i≤s} K_{1,nᵢ} and F₂ = ∪_{j≤t} K_{1,mⱼ}, prove that the size Ramsey number R̂(F₁,F₂) = Σ_{k=2}^{s+t} max{nᵢ + mⱼ - 1 : i + j = k}. The uniform case (all nᵢ equal, all mⱼ equal) was proven by Burr-Erdős-Faudree-Rousseau-Schelp (1978).

title: Erdős Problem #564: Hypergraph Ramsey Numbers
description: Is there a constant c > 0 such that R₃(n) ≥ 2^{2^{cn}}? An open problem asking whether the lower bound for 3-uniform hypergraph Ramsey numbers can match the tower height of the upper bound.

title: Erdős Problem #565: Induced Ramsey Numbers
description: Is R*(G) ≤ 2^{O(n)} for any graph G on n vertices, where R*(G) is the induced Ramsey number? SOLVED by Aragão, Campos, Dahia, Filipe, and Marciano (2025): YES!

title: Erdős Problem #57: Odd Cycles in Graphs with Infinite Chromatic Number
description: If G has infinite chromatic number and a₁ < a₂ < ⋯ are its odd cycle lengths, then ∑ 1/aᵢ = ∞. Solved by Liu-Montgomery (2020).

title: Cycle-Graph Ramsey Numbers
description: For k ≥ 3 and graph H with m edges (no isolated vertices), is R(C_k, H) ≤ 2m + ⌈(k-1)/2⌉? YES - fully resolved through work spanning 1993-2024.

title: Erdős Problem #571: Rational Turán Exponents for Bipartite Graphs
description: Is every rational α ∈ [1,2) a Turán exponent? Does there exist a bipartite graph G with ex(n;G) ≍ n^α for each such α? OPEN. Bukh-Conlon solved the finite family variant.

title: Erdős Problem #572: Lower Bound for Extremal Function of Even Cycles
description: Show that ex(n; C_{2k}) >> n^{1+1/k} for k >= 3. Proved for k=3,5 (Benson 1966); general case has weaker LUW bound.

title: Erdős Problem #573: Extremal Numbers for {C₃, C₄}-free Graphs
description: Is ex(n; {C₃, C₄}) ~ (n/2)^(3/2)? OPEN. Asks whether forbidding triangles along with 4-cycles gives asymptotic (n/2)^(3/2).

title: Erdős Problem #576: Turán Numbers for Hypercube Graphs
description: Determine the behavior of ex(n; Q_k), the Turán number for the k-dimensional hypercube graph. This is one of the major open problems in extremal graph theory.

title: Erdős Problem #577: Vertex-Disjoint 4-Cycles in Dense Graphs
description: If G is a graph with 4k vertices and minimum degree at least 2k, must G contain k vertex-disjoint 4-cycles? SOLVED by Wang (2010): YES, the Erdős-Faudree conjecture is true.

title: Erdős Problem #578: Hypercubes in Random Graphs
description: If G is a random graph on 2^d vertices with edge probability 1/2, does G almost surely contain Q_d? Answer: YES (Riordan 2000). Threshold p > 1/4 suffices, and copies are normally distributed.

title: Erdős Problem #58: Chromatic Number vs Odd Cycle Lengths
description: If G has at most k distinct odd cycle lengths, then χ(G) ≤ 2k+2, with equality iff G contains K_{2k+2}. Solved by Gyárfás (1992).

title: Erdős Problem #580: The Loebl-Komlós-Sós Conjecture
description: If a graph G on n vertices has at least n/2 vertices of degree at least n/2, must G contain every tree on at most n/2 vertices? YES for large n - proved by Zhao (2011).

title: Erdős Problem #581: Bipartite Subgraphs of Triangle-Free Graphs
description: Let f(m) be the maximal k such that every triangle-free graph with m edges contains a bipartite subgraph with k edges. Alon (1996) proved f(m) = m/2 + Θ(m^{4/5}).

title: Erdos Problem #582: Folkman Numbers and K4-Free Ramsey Graphs
description: Does there exist a K4-free graph where every 2-coloring of edges contains a monochromatic triangle? YES - proved by Folkman (1970).

title: Erdős Problem #583: Edge-Disjoint Path Partition Conjecture
description: Can every connected graph on n vertices be partitioned into at most ⌈n/2⌉ edge-disjoint paths? This Erdős-Gallai conjecture remains open.

title: Erdős Problem #584: Cycle-Connected Subgraphs
description: For a graph G with n vertices and δn² edges, must there exist subgraphs H₁ (≫ δ³n² edges, 6-cycle connected) and H₂ (≫ δ²n² edges, 8-cycle connected)? OPEN - best known: δ⁵ for H₁ (Duke-Erdős-Rödl 1984), δ > n^{-1/5} for H₂ (Fox-Sudakov 2008).

title: Erdős Problem #586
description: Is there a covering system such that no two of the moduli divide each other?

title: Erdős Problem #587: Square-Sum-Free Subsets
description: Determining the maximum size of a subset A of {1,...,N} such that no non-empty subset has a sum equal to a perfect square.

title: Erdős Problem #588: k-Point Lines in General Position
description: Is f_k(n) = o(n²) for k ≥ 4? Here f_k(n) is the max number of k-rich lines for n points with no k+1 collinear. OPEN. Best lower bound: n^{2-o(1)} (Solymosi-Stojaković 2013).

title: Erdős Problem #589: Points in General Position
description: Let g(n) be the minimum guaranteed size of a general position subset in any n-point planar set with no 4 collinear. Erdős thought g(n) = Ω(n), but actually n^(1/2)·log n ≪ g(n) ≤ n^(5/6+o(1)).

title: Erdős Problem #59: Counting G-Free Graphs
description: Is the number of G-free graphs on n vertices at most 2^{(1+o(1))ex(n;G)}? Disproved by Morris-Saxton (2016) for C_6.

title: Erdős #590: Ordinal Ramsey Theory for ω^ω
description: Does every 2-coloring of K_{ω^ω} contain a red K_{ω^ω} or a blue K_3? YES - proved by Chang (1972). The Ramsey property fails for ω³, ω⁴, ... but is restored for ω^ω.

title: Erdős Problem #591: Ordinal Ramsey Theory for ω^(ω²)
description: The ordinal Ramsey property ω^(ω²) → (ω^(ω²), 3)² holds. Proved independently by Schipperus (2010) and Darby.

title: Erdős Problem #594: Graphs with Chromatic Number ≥ ℵ₁ and Odd Cycles
description: Does every graph with chromatic number ≥ ℵ₁ contain all sufficiently large odd cycles? YES - proved by Erdős, Hajnal, and Shelah (1974).

title: Erdős Problem #595: Infinite Graphs and Countable Triangle-Free Decomposition
description: Is there an infinite graph G which contains no K₄ and is not the union of countably many triangle-free graphs? A fundamental question by Erdős and Hajnal about the chromatic structure of infinite graphs.

title: Erdős Problem #597: Partition Relations for Ordinal Powers
description: Does ω₁² → (ω₁ω, G)² for graphs G on ≤ℵ₁ vertices with no K₄ and no K_{ℵ₀,ℵ₀}? OPEN. Triangle case proven (Erdős-Hajnal), but K_{ℵ₀,ℵ₀} case fails (Baumgartner).

title: Erdős Problem #599: The Erdős-Menger Conjecture
description: For any graph G (possibly infinite) with disjoint independent sets A, B, must there exist vertex-disjoint A-B paths P and a set S that is both a transversal of P and a separator for all A-B paths? SOLVED: YES (Aharoni-Berger 2009).

title: Erdős Problem #6: Monotone Prime Gap Sequences
description: Are there infinitely many n with d_n < d_{n+1} < d_{n+2}? Proved affirmatively by Banks-Freiberg-Turnage-Butterbaugh (2015) using Maynard-Tao machinery.

title: Erdős Problem #60: Supersaturation of 4-Cycles
description: Does every graph on n vertices with > ex(n; C_4) edges contain Ω(n^{1/2}) copies of C_4? OPEN problem.

title: Edge-Triangle Containment Thresholds
description: Let e(n,r) be the minimal number of edges such that every graph on n vertices with at least e(n,r) edges, where each edge is in at least one triangle, must have some edge in at least r triangles. Questions: (1) Does e(n,r+1) - e(n,r) → ∞? (2) Does e(n,r+1)/e(n,r) → 1?

title: Erdős #601: Infinite Paths and Independent Sets in Ordinal Graphs
description: For which limit ordinals α must every graph on α have infinite path OR independent set of order type α? Known for α < ω₁^{ω+2}. Prize: $500.

title: Erdős Problem #602: 2-Coloring of Set Families with Property B
description: Given a family of countably infinite sets with pairwise intersections that are finite but ≠ 1, does there exist a 2-coloring of the union such that no member is monochromatic?

title: Erdos Problem #603: Set Family Colorings with Intersection Restrictions
description: Find the smallest cardinal C such that any family of countably infinite sets with |A_i ∩ A_j| != 2 can be colored with C colors so no set is monochromatic.

title: Erdős Problem #604: The Pinned Distance Problem
description: Given n distinct points in the plane, must some point have nearly n distinct distances to other points? The 'pinned' version of the distinct distances problem. OPEN with $500 prize.

title: Erdős Problem #605: Repeated Distances on a Sphere
description: Can n points be placed on a sphere with at least f(n)·n pairs at the same distance, where f(n) → ∞? Solved affirmatively: Swanepoel-Valtr proved u(n) ≫ n·√(log n), and for radius √2 we have u(n) ≈ n^{4/3}.

title: Erdős Problem #606: Distinct Lines from n Points
description: Given n distinct points in the plane, what are the possible values for the number of distinct lines they determine? Erdős and Salamon characterized the answer: all values from n to C(n,2) are achievable except C(n,2)-1 and C(n,2)-3.

title: Erdős Problem #607: Incidence Signatures of Point Configurations
description: For n points in ℝ², let A be the multiset of incidence counts (points per line). F(n) counts distinct achievable sets A. Szemerédi-Trotter proved F(n) ≤ exp(O(√n)), which is optimal.

title: Erdős #608: Edges in 5-Cycles
description: Does G with > n²/4 edges have ≥ (2/9)n² edges in C₅? NO! The correct bound is c = (2 + √2)/16 ≈ 0.2134. Füredi-Maleki and Grzesik-Hu-Volec determined the exact value.

title: Erdős Problem #609: Monochromatic Odd Cycles in Edge Colorings
description: Let f(n) = min cycle length forced in n-colorings of K_{2^n+1}. K_{2^n} can avoid all odd cycles, but K_{2^n+1} cannot. Estimate f(n). OPEN with exponential gap between bounds.

title: Erdős Problem #61: The Erdős–Hajnal Conjecture
description: For any graph H, does there exist c > 0 such that every H-free graph on n vertices has a clique or independent set of size at least n^c?

title: Erdős Problem #610: Clique Transversal Numbers
description: For a graph G, let τ(G) be the minimum vertices hitting every maximal clique. Known: τ(G) ≤ n - √(2n) + O(1). Open: Can we improve to n - ω(n)√n or n - c√(n log n)?

title: Erdős Problem #611: Clique Transversal with Large Cliques
description: If all maximal cliques have size ≥ cn, is τ(G) = o(n)? Estimate k_c(n) such that cliques of size ≥ k_c(n) force τ < (1-c)n. Bollobás-Erdős: cliques ≥ n+3-2√n give τ = 1.

title: Erdős Problem #612: Diameter Bounds for Clique-Free Graphs
description: For connected K_r-free graphs: what is the relationship between diameter D, minimum degree d, and vertex count n? Original conjecture D ≤ α·n/d + O(1) disproved for r ≥ 4; base case (triangle-free) remains valid.

title: Erdős Problem #613: Graph Decomposition and Size Ramsey Numbers
description: Can graphs with C(2n+1,2) - C(n,2) - 1 edges be decomposed into bipartite + bounded-degree? DISPROVED by Pikhurko; Tao verified n=5 counterexample in Lean. Bounds: n² + 0.577n^{3/2} < r̂ < n² + √2·n^{3/2} + n.

title: Erdős Problem #614: Minimum Edges for Induced Maximum Degree
description: Let f(n,k) be the minimal number of edges such that there exists a graph on n vertices where every (k+2)-subset induces a subgraph with maximum degree at least k. Determine f(n,k). OPEN.

title: Erdos Problem #615: Ramsey-Turan Number rt(n; 4, n/log n)
description: Does there exist c > 0 such that graphs with (1/8-c)n^2 edges must contain K4 or independence set of size n/log n? NO, disproved by Fox-Loh-Zhao (2015).

title: Erdős Problem #616: Covering Numbers of Hypergraphs
description: Determine the best constant t(r) such that if every subgraph on ≤ 3r-3 vertices of an r-uniform hypergraph has covering number ≤ 1, then the global covering number is ≤ t(r). Erdős-Hajnal-Tuza proved (3/16)r ≤ t(r) ≤ (1/5)r but the exact coefficient remains OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #617: Balanced Colourings of Complete Graphs
description: Let r ≥ 3. If the edges of K_{r²+1} are r-coloured, then there exist r+1 vertices with at least one colour missing on the edges of the induced K_{r+1}. In other words, no balanced colouring exists.

title: Erdős Problem #618: Decreasing Diameter of Triangle-Free Graphs
description: For a triangle-free graph G, let h₂(G) be the minimum edges to add for diameter 2 while staying triangle-free. Proved: Δ = o(n^{1/2}) implies h₂(G) = o(n²).

title: Erdős Problem #619: Decreasing Diameter of Triangle-Free Graphs
description: Does there exist c > 0 such that h₄(G) < (1-c)n for triangle-free graphs G? Known: h₃ ≤ n, h₅ ≤ (n-1)/2. Status: OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #62: Common Subgraphs of Graphs with Chromatic Number ℵ₁
description: If G₁, G₂ both have chromatic number ℵ₁, must they share a common subgraph with χ = 4 (or ℵ₀)? OPEN problem.

title: Erdős Problem #620: The Erdős-Rogers Problem
description: In any K₄-free graph on n vertices, how large a triangle-free induced subgraph must exist? Current bounds: √n·√(log n)/log log n ≪ f(n) ≪ √n·log n. The gap represents fundamental uncertainty about extremal K₄-free graph structure.

title: Erdős #621: Triangle Edge Covers
description: For graph G on n vertices, is α₁(G) + τ₁(G) ≤ n²/4? Solved by Norin-Sun (2016) with the stronger result α₁(G) + τ_B(G) ≤ n²/4.

title: Erdős Problem #622: Cycle-Spanning Subsets in Regular Graphs
description: Let G be a regular graph with 2n vertices and degree n+1. Must G have ≫ 2^{2n} subsets spanned by a cycle? SOLVED by Draganić-Keevash-Müyesser (2025): YES, at least (1/2 + o(1))2^{2n} subsets, asymptotically tight.

title: Erdős #623: Independence for Functions on Finite Subsets
description: Let X have cardinality ℵ_ω and f: Finset(X) → X satisfy f(A) ∉ A. Must there exist an infinite independent set Y ⊆ X where f(B) ∉ Y for all finite B ⊆ Y? OPEN - possibly undecidable.

title: Covering Properties of Subset Functions
description: Let X be a finite set of size n. What is the minimum H(n) such that some function f: P(X) -> X covers all of X from any subset Y of size at least H(n)?

title: Erdős #625: Chromatic vs Cochromatic Numbers of Random Graphs
description: For G(n, 1/2), does χ(G) - ζ(G) → ∞ almost surely? The cochromatic number ζ(G) allows color classes to be cliques or independent sets. Heckel/Steiner (2024) proved the difference is unbounded. Prize: $1000 (false) / $100 (true).

title: Erdős Problem #626: Chromatic Number and Girth
description: Let g_k(n) be the largest m such that there exists an n-vertex graph with chromatic number k and girth > m. Does lim_{n→∞} g_k(n)/log n exist? Bounds: (1/4 log k)·log n ≤ g_k(n) ≤ (2/log(k-2))·log n + 1.

title: Erdős Problem #627: Chromatic Number and Clique Number Ratio
description: Let f(n) = max χ(G)/ω(G) over n-vertex graphs. Does lim_{n→∞} f(n)/(n/(log n)²) exist? Known: f(n) ≍ n/(log n)², and if limit exists it's in (log 2)²·[1/4,1] ≈ [0.12, 0.48].

title: Erdős Problem #628: The Erdős-Lovász Tihany Conjecture
description: If χ(G) = k and G is K_k-free, must G be (a,b)-splittable for a,b ≥ 2 with a + b = k + 1? Special cases proven: a = b = 3 (Brown-Jung), quasi-line graphs, α = 2 (Balogh et al.).

title: Erdős #629: List Chromatic Number of Bipartite Graphs
description: Find n(k) = minimal vertices in bipartite G with list chromatic number χ_L(G) > k. Surprisingly, χ_L can be arbitrarily large even though χ ≤ 2!

title: Erdős Problem #63: Cycles of Length 2^n in Infinite Chromatic Graphs
description: Every graph with infinite chromatic number contains a cycle of length 2^n for infinitely many n. SOLVED by Liu-Montgomery (2020).

title: Erdős Problem #630: List Chromatic Number of Planar Bipartite Graphs
description: Does every planar bipartite graph have χ_L ≤ 3? SOLVED: YES by Alon-Tarsi (1992) using the Combinatorial Nullstellensatz. The bound is tight (K_{2,4} achieves it).

title: Erdős Problem #631: List Chromatic Number of Planar Graphs
description: Does every planar graph have χ_L ≤ 5? Is this best possible? SOLVED: YES (Thomassen 1994) and YES (Voigt 1993). The bound is tight.

title: Erdős Problem #632: The (a,b)-Choosability Scaling Conjecture
description: If G is (a,b)-choosable, is G also (am,bm)-choosable for all m ≥ 1? DISPROVED by Dvořák-Hu-Sereni (2019) - fails for (4,1) to (8,2).

title: Erdős Problem #633: Square Number Triangle Dissections
description: Which triangles can ONLY be cut into a perfect square number of congruent triangles? Classification remains OPEN with $25 prize.

title: Erdős Problem #634: Triangle Dissection into Congruent Pieces
description: Find all n such that some triangle can be cut into n congruent triangles. OPEN: k², 2k², 3k², k²+m² work; 7, 11 fail (Beeson); 19 unknown. $25 prize.

title: Erdős Problem #636: Distinct Induced Subgraphs in Ramsey Graphs
description: Must a Ramsey graph (no large clique or independent set) on n vertices have Θ(n^(5/2)) induced subgraphs with distinct (vertex, edge) signatures? SOLVED by Kwan-Sudakov (2021).

title: Erdős #637: Distinct Degrees in Induced Subgraphs
description: If G on n vertices has no clique/independent set on ≫ log n vertices, then G contains an induced subgraph with ≫ √n distinct degrees. Bukh-Sudakov (2007) proved this; JKLY (2020) strengthened to ≫ n^{2/3} degrees.

title: Erdős Problem #639: Edges Not in Monochromatic Triangles
description: In a 2-coloring of K_n, are there at most n²/4 edges not appearing in any monochromatic triangle? SOLVED: Keevash-Sudakov (2004) determined the exact threshold for all n.

title: Erdős Problem #64: Power of Two Cycles in Min Degree 3 Graphs
description: Does every finite graph with minimum degree ≥ 3 contain a cycle of length 2^k for some k ≥ 2? OPEN ($1000 prize).

title: Erdős Problem #641: Edge-Disjoint Cycles on Same Vertex Set
description: Is there a function f such that χ(G) ≥ f(k) implies G has k edge-disjoint cycles on the same vertices? DISPROVED by Janzer-Steiner-Sudakov (2024) - fails even for k=2.

title: Erdős Problem #642: Cycles with More Vertices than Diagonals
description: Let f(n) be the maximal edges in a graph where every cycle has more vertices than diagonals. Is f(n) ≪ n? OPEN: Ω(n^(3/2)) ≤ f(n) ≤ O(n(log n)^8).

title: Erdős Problem #643: Crossed Pairs in Hypergraphs
description: Let f(n;t) be the minimal number of edges such that any t-uniform hypergraph on n vertices must contain four edges A,B,C,D with A∪B = C∪D and A∩B = C∩D = ∅. Conjecture: f(n;t) = (1+o(1))·C(n,t-1) for t≥3.

title: Erdős #644: Covering Families of Sets
description: Let f(k,r) be the minimum size of a covering set for k-uniform families where every r sets share a common pair. Known: f(k,3)=2k, f(k,4)=⌊3k/2⌋, f(k,5)=⌊5k/4⌋, f(k,6)=k. Is f(k,7)=(3/4+o(1))k?

title: Erdős Problem #645: Monochromatic AP with Large Difference
description: If ℕ is 2-colored, must there exist a monochromatic 3-term arithmetic progression x, x+d, x+2d such that d > x? This is a strengthening of van der Waerden's theorem requiring the common difference to exceed the first term.

title: Erdős Problem #646: Even Powers of Primes Dividing Factorials
description: For distinct primes p₁,...,pₖ, are there infinitely many n where n! is divisible by an even power of each pᵢ? YES, proved by Berend (1997) with bounded gaps.

title: Erdős Problem #647: Divisor Function Gap Problem
description: Let τ(n) count divisors of n. Is there n > 24 such that max_{m<n}(m + τ(m)) ≤ n + 2? The case n = 24 works, but Erdős doubted any larger n exists. Prize: £25 (~$44).

title: Erdős Problem #648: Decreasing Greatest Prime Factors
description: Let g(n) be the longest increasing sequence below n with strictly decreasing greatest prime factors. What is g(n)? SOLVED: g(n) ≍ (n/log n)^(1/2) (Cambie 2025).

title: Erdős Problem #649: Greatest Prime Factors of Consecutive Integers
description: Can any two primes p, q be achieved as P(n) = p and P(n+1) = q for some n? DISPROVED: The pair (2, 7) fails since 2^k ≢ -1 (mod 7) for all k.

title: Erdős Problem #65: Cycle Lengths in Dense Graphs
description: Let G be a graph with n vertices and kn edges. Is the sum of reciprocals of cycle lengths Σ 1/aᵢ ≫ log k? Is this sum minimized when G is complete bipartite?

title: Erdős #650: Divisibility Covering in Intervals
description: If A ⊆ {1,...,N} with |A| = m, every interval of length 2N contains ≥ f(m) integers divisible by distinct elements of A. Known: f(m) ≫ √m. Open: Is f(m) ≪ √m?

title: Erdős Problem #651: Convex Polyhedra from Points in General Position
description: Is f_k(n) > (1 + c_k)^n for finding convex polyhedra in ℝ^k? NO, disproved by Pohoata-Zakharov (2022) showing f_3(n) ≤ 2^{o(n)}.

title: Erdős Problem #652: Distance Multiplicity Spectrum in Point Sets
description: Does αₖ → ∞ as k → ∞, where αₖ is the minimal constant such that R(xₖ) < αₖ√n is achievable? Answer: YES (Mathialagan 2021).

title: Erdős Problem #653: Distinct Distance Counts in the Plane
description: For n points in the plane, let R(xᵢ) count distinct distances from xᵢ. What is the maximum number of distinct R-values? Conjecture: g(n) ≥ (1-o(1))n. OPEN with bounds 0.7n < g(n) < n - cn^{2/3}.

title: Erdős Problem #656: Density Version of Hindman's Theorem
description: Let A ⊆ ℕ have positive upper density. Must there exist infinite B and integer t with B+B+t ⊆ A? YES! Proved by Kra-Moreira-Richter-Robertson (2024).

title: Erdős Problem #657: Isosceles-Free Point Sets and Distinct Distances
description: If A ⊂ ℝ² is a set of n points with no isosceles triangles, must A determine at least f(n)·n distinct distances for some f(n) → ∞? PARTIALLY SOLVED: YES. Bounds: 2^{c(log n)^{1/9}} ≤ f(n) ≤ 2^{O(√log n)}.

title: Erdős Problem #658: Squares in Dense Grid Subsets
description: Do dense subsets of the N×N grid contain squares? YES, proved via density Hales-Jewett (Furstenberg-Katznelson 1991), with quantitative bounds by Solymosi (2004).

title: Erdős Problem #659: Point Configurations with Few Distances
description: Is there a set of n points in R² such that every 4-point subset determines at least 3 distances, yet the total distinct distances is O(n/√log n)? Answer: Yes, via the Moree-Osburn lattice.

title: Erdős Problem #66: Representation Function Asymptotics
description: Is there a set A ⊆ ℕ such that the representation function r_A(n) = |{(a,b) ∈ A² : a+b=n}| satisfies lim r_A(n)/log(n) = c ≠ 0?

title: Distinct Distances in Convex Polyhedra
description: For vertices of a convex polyhedron in ℝ³, are there at least (1-o(1))·n/2 distinct pairwise distances? This extends Altman's 2D result to three dimensions.

title: Erdős Problem #664: Blocking Sets with Bounded Intersection
description: For set families with |Aᵢ| > c√n and pairwise |Aᵢ ∩ Aⱼ| ≤ 1, must a blocker exist with O(1) intersection? DISPROVED by Alon using projective plane constructions.

title: Erdős Problem #665
description:
Forum
Favourites
Tags
More
 Go
 Go
Dual View
Random Solved
Random Open

Is there some constant ... such that for every ... there are ... such that ... for all ..., and ... for all ..., and every pa...

title: Erdős Problem #666: C₆ in Hypercube Subgraphs
description: Does every ε-dense subgraph of the n-hypercube Qₙ contain C₆? Answer: NO. Chung (1992) and Brouwer-Dejter-Thomassen (1993) showed Qₙ can be 4-partitioned into C₆-free subgraphs.

title: Erdos Problem #668: Unit Distance Configuration Uniqueness
description: Does the number of incongruent extremal unit distance configurations tend to infinity? Is there more than one for n > 3?

title: Erdős Problem #669: k-Point Lines - Exact and At-Least Counts
description: Estimate f_k(n) (exactly k points) and F_k(n) (at least k points). For k=3, the Orchard Problem: f_3(n) = F_3(n) = n²/6 - O(n) (Burr-Grünbaum-Sloane 1974). SOLVED for k=3.

title: Erdős Problem #67: The Erdős Discrepancy Problem
description: For any ±1 sequence f: ℕ → {-1,+1}, must the partial sums along some arithmetic progression be unbounded? (Solved: YES, by Tao 2015)

title: Erdős Problem #670: Diameter of Sets with Distinct Distances
description: Let A ⊆ ℝ^d be n points with all pairwise distances differing by at least 1. Is diameter(A) ≥ (1+o(1))n²? Proved for d=1 by Erdős (1997). Higher dimensions remain OPEN.

title: Erdos Problem #671: Lagrange Interpolation Convergence
description: Can Lagrange interpolation converge at points where the Lebesgue function diverges? Two open questions with $250 prize. Bernstein (1931) and Erdos-Vertesi (1980) established fundamental divergence results.

title: Erdős Problem #672: Products of Arithmetic Progressions as Perfect Powers
description: Can the product n(n+d)(n+2d)···(n+(k-1)d) of k≥4 terms in arithmetic progression (with gcd(n,d)=1) be a perfect power? Euler proved k=4, l=2 impossible. Obláth extended to more cases. Erdős-Selfridge (1975) settled the consecutive case (d=1). General case remains OPEN.

title: Erdős #673: Sum of Consecutive Divisor Ratios
description: For G(n) = Σ dᵢ/dᵢ₊₁ (consecutive divisor ratios), does G(n) → ∞ for almost all n? What is the asymptotic formula for Σ G(n)? Solved: Tao gave bounds τ(n/m)/m ≤ G(n) ≤ τ(n).

title: Erdős #674: The Equation x^x y^y = z^z
description: Are there integer solutions to x^x y^y = z^z with x, y, z > 1? Yes! Ko (1940) found infinitely many. Dem'janenko (1975) proved all solutions share the same prime factors.

title: Erdős Problem #676: Representations ap² + b with p Prime
description: Is every sufficiently large integer expressible as ap² + b for some prime p, integer a >= 1, and 0 <= b < p?

title: Erdős Problem #678: LCM of Consecutive Integers
description: Can a shorter interval of consecutive integers have larger LCM than a longer interval starting later? Yes! Solved by Cambie (2024) with Lean proof.

title: Erdős #679: Small ω(n-k) for All k < n
description: Are there infinitely many n such that ω(n-k) < (1+ε) log k / log log k for all large k < n? The main question is OPEN; the stronger version with O(1) error is FALSE.

title: Erdős Problem #682: Rough Numbers Between Consecutive Primes
description: Is it true that for almost all n there exists m ∈ (p_n, p_{n+1}) with p(m) ≥ g_n? YES - Gafni-Tao (2025) proved E(X) ≪ X/(log X)².

title: Erdős Problem #683: Largest Prime Divisor of Binomial Coefficients
description: For 1 ≤ k ≤ n, is P(C(n,k)) ≥ min(n-k+1, k^{1+c}) for some c > 0? Sylvester-Schur (1892/1929) proved P(C(n,k)) > k. Erdős (1955) improved this to P(C(n,k)) ≫ k log k. The full conjecture remains OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #684: Smooth Parts of Binomial Coefficients
description: Find bounds on f(n) = smallest k such that the k-smooth part of C(n,k) exceeds n².

title: Erdős Problem #69: Irrationality of Sum of Omega over Powers of 2
description: Is the sum of ω(n)/2^n for n≥2 irrational? Proved by Tao-Teräväinen (2025) via reduction to sum of 1/(2^p-1) over primes.

title: Erdős Problem #692: Unimodularity of Divisor Density
description: Let δ₁(n,m) be the density of integers with exactly one divisor in (n,m). Is δ₁(n,m) unimodal for m > n+1? DISPROVED by Cambie (2025) with explicit counterexamples showing superpolynomially many local maxima.

title: Erdős Problem #693: Divisor Gaps in Intervals
description: Is the maximum gap between consecutive integers with a divisor in (n, 2n) bounded polylogarithmically?

title: Erdős Problem #694: Preimages of Euler's Totient Function
description: Investigate max f_max(n)/f_min(n) where f_max(n) and f_min(n) are the largest and smallest m with φ(m) = n. Related to Carmichael's conjecture: does φ(m) = n ever have exactly one solution?

title: Erdős Problem #695: Prime Chain Growth
description: Let p₁ < p₂ < ⋯ be primes with p_{i+1} ≡ 1 (mod p_i). Is lim p_k^{1/k} = ∞? Can p_k ≤ exp(k(log k)^{1+o(1)})?

title: Erdős Problem #696: Chains of Prime Divisors with Congruence Conditions
description: Let h(n) = max length of prime chain p₁ < ... < pₗ dividing n with pᵢ₊₁ ≡ 1 (mod pᵢ). Let H(n) use divisors. Estimate these functions. PARTIALLY SOLVED: h(n) → ∞ almost always (van Doorn). Ratio question open.

title: Erdős Problem #697: Density of Integers Divisible by d ≡ 1 (mod m)
description: Let δ(m,α) be the density of integers divisible by some d ≡ 1 (mod m) with 1 < d < exp(m^α). Does a sharp threshold β exist? SOLVED: YES, β = 1/log 2 ≈ 1.443 (Hall 1992).

title: Erdős Problem #698: GCDs of Binomial Coefficients
description: Is there h(n) → ∞ such that gcd(C(n,i), C(n,j)) ≥ h(n) for all 2 ≤ i < j ≤ n/2? YES - Bergman (2011) proved gcd ≫ n^{1/2} · 2^i / i^{3/2}.

title: Erdős Problem #699: Prime Divisors of GCDs of Binomial Coefficients
description: For 1 ≤ i < j ≤ n/2, does there exist a prime p ≥ i dividing gcd(C(n,i), C(n,j))? An open problem extending the Sylvester-Schur theorem from single binomial coefficients to their GCDs.

title: Erdős Problem #7: Odd Covering Systems
description: Is there a covering system all of whose moduli are odd? Also known as the Erdős-Selfridge Conjecture. OPEN with significant partial results.

title: Erdős Problem #70: Partition Calculus for the Continuum
description: Let 𝔠 be the cardinality of the continuum, β be any countable ordinal, and 2 ≤ n < ω. Is it true that 𝔠 → (β, n)₂³? OPEN.

title: Chvátal's Conjecture on Intersecting Families
description: Let F be a hereditary family. There exists x such that every intersecting subfamily F' has |F'| ≤ |{A ∈ F : x ∈ A}|. Status: OPEN with partial results.

title: Erdős Problem #702: Singleton Intersections in k-Uniform Families
description: For k ≥ 4, if F is a k-uniform family over {1,...,n} with |F| > C(n-2, k-2), must some pair have |A ∩ B| = 1? SOLVED by Frankl (1977): YES, the bound is tight.

title: Forbidden r-Intersection Families
description: Define T(n,r) as the maximum family size avoiding r-intersection. Is T(n,r) < (2-δ)^n for εn < r < (1/2-ε)n? SOLVED: YES (Frankl-Rödl 1987). Exact values known for small r (Frankl-Füredi 1984).

title: Erdős Problem #704: Chromatic Number of Unit Distance Graphs
description: Estimate χ(Gₙ), the chromatic number of the unit distance graph in ℝⁿ. Exponential growth established: 1.2ⁿ ≤ χ(Gₙ) ≤ 3ⁿ. Exact base open.

title: Erdős Problem #707: Embedding Sidon Sets in Perfect Difference Sets
description: Can every finite Sidon set be embedded in a perfect difference set modulo p^2+p+1 for some prime p? DISPROVED: Hall (1947) and Alexeev-Mixon (2025) provided counterexamples.

title: Erdős Problem #708: Divisibility of Products by Consecutive Integers
description: Let g(n) be minimal such that for any set A of n integers and any interval I of consecutive integers, some B ⊆ I with |B| = g(n) has product divisible by the product of A. Is g(n) ≤ (2 + o(1))n?

title: Erdős Problem #709: Divisibility in Intervals
description: Find tight bounds for f(n), the minimal function such that any interval of f(n)·max(A) consecutive integers contains distinct multiples of each element of A. Known: (log n)^c ≪ f(n) ≪ √n. Status: OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #71: Cycle Lengths in Arithmetic Progressions
description: For every arithmetic progression P containing even numbers, does there exist c(P) such that graphs with average degree ≥ c contain a cycle of length in P? SOLVED by Bollobás (1977): YES.

title: Erdős Problem #710: Minimal Interval for Divisibility Matching
description: Let f(n) be minimal such that in (n, n+f(n)) there exist distinct integers a₁,...,aₙ with k|aₖ for all k. Obtain an asymptotic formula for f(n). Known bounds differ by √(log log n) factor; exact asymptotics remain OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #711: Divisibility Matching with Variable Starting Point
description: Let f(n,m) be minimal such that (m, m+f(n,m)) contains distinct a₁,...,aₙ with k|aₖ. Prove max_m f(n,m) ≤ n^{1+o(1)} [OPEN] and max_m(f(n,m)-f(n,n))→∞ [SOLVED by van Doorn 2026].

title: Erdős Problem #712: Hypergraph Turán Densities
description: Determine the Turán density lim ex_r(n, K_k^r)/C(n,r) for k > r > 2. One of the most famous open problems in extremal combinatorics. Prize: $500/$1000.

title: Erdős Problem #713: Rational Exponents for Bipartite Turán Numbers
description: Does ex(n; G) ~ c·n^α for every bipartite G? Must α be rational? Original conjecture (α ∈ {1+1/k, 2-1/k}) disproved by Erdős-Simonovits (1970). Main questions remain OPEN. Prize: $500.

title: Erdős Problem #714: The Zarankiewicz Problem for K_{r,r}
description: Is ex(n; K_{r,r}) >> n^{2-1/r}? Proved for r=2,3; open for r >= 4. The Zarankiewicz problem on complete bipartite subgraphs.

title: Erdős Problem #715: Regular Subgraphs in Regular Graphs
description: Does every 4-regular graph contain a 3-regular subgraph? SOLVED: YES by Tashkinov (1982). Every r-regular graph with r ≥ 4 contains a 3-regular subgraph.

title: The Ruzsa-Szemerédi (6,3) Problem
description: Let ℱ be the family of all 3-uniform hypergraphs with 6 vertices and 3 edges. Is ex₃(n, ℱ) = o(n²)? Equivalently, what is the maximum number of edges in a graph where every edge belongs to a unique triangle? Solved by Ruzsa-Szemerédi (1978).

title: Erdős Problem #717: Chromatic Number and Clique Subdivisions
description: Is χ(G) ≤ C · (n^{1/2}/log n) · σ(G) for all n-vertex graphs? YES - Fox, Lee, Sudakov (2013) proved this tight bound matching the Erdős-Fajtlowicz lower bound.

title: Erdős Problem #718: Subdivisions of Complete Graphs
description: Is there a constant C > 0 such that any graph on n vertices with ≥ Cr²n edges contains a subdivision of Kᵣ? Yes, proved independently by Komlós-Szemerédi and Bollobás-Thomason in 1996.

title: Erdős Problem #72: Unavoidable Cycle Lengths
description: Given a sparse set A of natural numbers and sufficiently high average degree, must every large graph contain a cycle whose length is in A? This $100 problem was solved affirmatively, with Liu and Montgomery's 2020 result contradicting Erdős's original intuition about powers of 2.

title: Erdős Problem #720: Size Ramsey Numbers of Paths and Cycles
description: Let R̂(G) denote the size Ramsey number. Does R̂(Pₙ)/n → ∞ and R̂(Pₙ)/n² → 0? Does R̂(Cₙ) = o(n²)? SOLVED: Beck (1983) proved R̂(Pₙ) ≪ n and R̂(Cₙ) ≪ n — both are LINEAR in n!

title: Erdős Problem #721: Van der Waerden Numbers W(3,k)
description: Give reasonable bounds for W(3,k), the minimum n such that any red/blue coloring of {1,...,n} contains a red 3-AP or blue k-AP. SOLVED: Both challenges met - superpolynomial lower bounds (Green, Hunter) and subexponential upper bounds (Schoen, Bloom-Sisask).

title: Erdős Problem #722: Existence of Steiner Systems
description: Do Steiner systems S(r,k,n) exist for large n when divisibility conditions are met? SOLVED by Keevash (2014) using randomized algebraic construction.

title: Erdős Problem #723: Prime Power Conjecture for Projective Planes
description: If there is a finite projective plane of order n, must n be a prime power? OPEN in general. Verified for n ≤ 11, with Bruck-Ryser application for n=6 fully verified.

title: Erdős Problem #724: Mutually Orthogonal Latin Squares
description: Is f(n) ≫ n^(1/2) where f(n) is the maximum number of mutually orthogonal Latin squares of order n?

title: Erdős Problem #725: Asymptotic Counting of Latin Rectangles
description: Give an asymptotic formula for the number of k×n Latin rectangles. Known: L(k,n) ~ e^{-C(k,2)}(n!)^k for k ≤ n^{1/3-o(1)}. General formula: OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #727: Factorial Divisibility
description: For k ≥ 2, does ((n+k)!)² divide (2n)! for infinitely many n? The main problem is OPEN, but Balakran (1929) solved the k=1 case, and EGRS showed a weaker variant holds for all k ≥ 2.

title: Erdos Problem #728: Factorial Divisibility with Logarithmic Gap
description: Can a!b! divide n!(a+b-n)! with a,b > epsilon*n and a+b in the range (n + C log n, n + C' log n)?

title: Erdos Problem #728: Factorial Divisibility
description: A milestone in AI mathematics: GPT-5.2 and Aristotle autonomously solved this factorial divisibility problem, producing genuinely novel mathematics not found in existing literature.

title: Erdős Problem #729: Factorial Divisibility Modulo Small Primes
description: Let C > 0. Are there infinitely many (a, b, n) with a + b > n + C·log n such that n!/(a!b!) has denominator with only small primes? Barreto-Leeham proved NO: the bound a + b ≤ n + O(log n) persists even ignoring small primes.

title: Erdős Problem #73: Almost Bipartite Graphs
description: If every subgraph of G has an independent set covering at least half its vertices (minus k), must G be 'almost bipartite' - the union of a bipartite graph and O(1) extra vertices? Reed's 'Mangoes and Blueberries' paper (1999) proves yes.

title: Erdős Problem #732: Block-Compatible Sequences
description: A sequence 1 < X₁ ≤ ... ≤ Xₘ ≤ n is block-compatible if there exists a pairwise balanced block design with those block sizes. Q1: Characterize such sequences. Q2: Count them.

title: Erdos Problem #733: Line-Compatible Sequences
description: How many line-compatible sequences exist for n points? Answer: exp(Theta(n^{1/2})), proved by Szemeredi-Trotter (1983).

title: Erdős Problem #734: Pairwise Balanced Block Designs with Bounded Frequencies
description: Find a non-trivial PBD where all block sizes have O(n^{1/2}) frequency. OPEN. de Bruijn-Erdős (1948) implies some size must have high frequency on average.

title: Erdős Problem #735: Magic Configurations
description: Characterize point configurations admitting positive weights with equal sums on all lines (magic configurations).

title: Chromatic Numbers and Finite Subgraph Inheritance
description: Taylor's conjecture: If G has chromatic number ℵ₁, can we build graphs of any chromatic number using only finite subgraphs of G? Komjáth-Shelah showed this is independent of ZFC - it can fail in some models.

title: Erdős Problem #737: Edge in All Large Cycles
description: Let G have chromatic number ℵ₁. Must there exist an edge e in cycles of all large lengths? YES (Thomassen 1983).

title: Erdős Problem #739: Chromatic Numbers of Subgraphs (Infinite)
description: If G has infinite chromatic number 𝔪, must G have subgraphs of all smaller infinite chromatic numbers? INDEPENDENT OF ZFC: YES under V=L (Shelah 1990), NO in some models (Komjáth 1988). Open under GCH.

title: Erdős Problem #74: Almost Bipartite Graphs with High Chromatic Number
description: For f(n) → ∞, is there a graph with infinite chromatic number where every n-vertex subgraph can be made bipartite by deleting ≤ f(n) edges?

title: Erdős Problem #740: Chromatic Number and Odd Cycle Avoidance
description: Must every graph with infinite chromatic number 𝔪 contain a subgraph with χ = 𝔪 that avoids all odd cycles of length ≤ r?

title: Erdős Problem #742: Maximum Edges in Minimal Diameter-2 Graphs
description: Let G be a graph on n vertices with diameter 2, such that deleting any edge increases the diameter. Is it true that G has at most n²/4 edges? SOLVED by Füredi (1992): YES for sufficiently large n. The complete bipartite graph K_{⌊n/2⌋,⌈n/2⌉} shows this bound is tight.

title: Erdős Problem #743: Tree Packing Conjecture
description: Can Kₙ always be decomposed as edge-disjoint union of trees T₂,...,Tₙ where Tₖ has k vertices? Known for stars/paths (Gyárfás-Lehel 1978), bounded degree (JKKO 2019), and small/large trees (Bollobás 1983, Janzer-Montgomery 2024).

title: Erdős Problem #745: Second Largest Component of Random Graphs
description: Describe the second largest component of G(n, 1/n). Answer: It has size Θ(log n) almost surely. Proved by Komlós-Sulyok-Szemerédi (1980).

title: Erdős Problem #746: Hamiltonicity of Random Graphs
description: Is a random graph with ≥ (1/2+ε)n log n edges almost surely Hamiltonian? SOLVED: YES. Sharp threshold (1/2)n log n + (1/2)n log log n (Korshunov, Komlós-Szemerédi).

title: Erdős Problem #747: Shamir's Problem (Perfect Matchings in Random Hypergraphs)
description: How large should ℓ(n) be such that a random 3-uniform hypergraph on 3n vertices with ℓ(n) edges a.s. has n vertex-disjoint edges? SOLVED: ℓ(n) ~ n log n (Johansson-Kahn-Vu 2008, Kahn 2023).

title: Erdős Problem #748: The Cameron-Erdős Conjecture
description: Is f(n) = 2^{(1+o(1))n/2} where f(n) counts sum-free subsets? YES, proved by Green (2004) and Sapozhenko (2003).

title: Erdos Problem #751: Cycle Lengths in 4-Chromatic Graphs
description: For graphs with chromatic number 4, can consecutive cycle lengths have arbitrarily large gaps? Answer: NO - Bondy-Vince (1998) proved min degree >= 3 implies two cycles differ by at most 2.

title: Erdős Problem #752: Cycle Lengths in High-Girth Graphs
description: Let G be a graph with minimum degree k and girth > 2s. Must there be ≫ k^s many distinct cycle lengths in G? Answer: YES (Sudakov-Verstraëte 2008).

title: Erdős Problem #753: List Chromatic Number of Graph and Complement
description: Does there exist some constant c > 0 such that χ_L(G) + χ_L(G^c) > n^{1/2+c} for every graph G on n vertices? Answer: NO (Alon 1992) - counterexamples exist with χ_L(G) + χ_L(G^c) ≤ O((n log n)^{1/2}).

title: Erdős Problem #754: Favorite Distances in Four Dimensions
description: In n points in ℝ⁴, each point can have at most n/2 + O(1) equidistant neighbors. Proved by Swanepoel (2013) after initial bounds by Avis-Erdős-Pach (1988).

title: Erdős Problem #755: Equilateral Triangles in ℝ⁶
description: The maximum number of unit equilateral triangles formed by n points in ℝ⁶ is at most (1/27 + o(1))n³. YES, proved by Clemen-Dumitrescu-Liu (2025) - even for triangles of any size.

title: Erdős Problem #756: Rich Distances in the Plane
description: Can there be ≫n distinct distances each occurring more than n times among n points in ℝ²? SOLVED: YES (Bhowmick 2024) - constructs n points with ⌊n/4⌋ rich distances.

title: Erdős Problem #757: Sidon Sets in Almost-Sidon Families
description: Let A ⊂ ℝ be a set of size n such that every 4-element subset B has |B - B| ≥ 11. Find the best constant c > 0 such that A must contain a Sidon set of size ≥ cn. Known: 1/2 < c < 3/5.

title: Erdős Problem #758: Cochromatic Number z(n)
description: The cochromatic number ζ(G) is the minimum colors needed to color vertices such that each color class induces either a complete or empty graph. Let z(n) = max{ζ(G) : G has n vertices}. Is z(12) = 4? Answer: YES (Bhavik Mehta, computational).

title: Erdős Problem #759: Cochromatic Number on Surfaces
description: Determine the growth rate of z(S_n), the maximum cochromatic number on genus-n surfaces. Answer: z(S_n) ≍ √n / log n (Gimbel-Thomassen 1997).

title: Erdős Problem #76: Monochromatic Triangle Packings
description: In any 2-coloring of the complete graph K_n, how many edge-disjoint monochromatic triangles must exist? Erdős, Faudree, and Ordman conjectured the answer is (1+o(1))n²/12, proved optimal by Gruslys and Letzter in 2020.

title: Erdős Problem #760: Cochromatic Number of Subgraphs
description: If G is a graph with chromatic number χ(G) = m, must G contain a subgraph H with cochromatic number ζ(H) ≫ m / log m? YES, proved by Alon-Krivelevich-Sudakov (1997).

title: Erdős Problem #762: Chromatic vs Cochromatic Number
description: Is χ(G) ≤ ζ(G) + 2 when G has no K₅ and ζ(G) ≥ 4? DISPROVED by Steiner (2024) who constructed a graph with ω=4, ζ=4, χ=7.

title: Erdős Problem #763: The Erdős-Fuchs Theorem
description: Can a set A ⊆ ℕ have representation count ∑_{n≤N} r_A(n) = cN + O(1)? NO - disproved by Erdős-Fuchs (1956).

title: Erdős Problem #764: 3-Fold Convolution Linear Error
description: Can ∑_{n≤N} 1_A * 1_A * 1_A(n) = cN + O(1) for some A ⊆ ℕ and c > 0? Answer: NO (Vaughan 1972).

title: Erdős Problem #765: Asymptotic Formula for ex(n; C₄)
description: Determine an asymptotic formula for ex(n; C₄), the maximum number of edges in an n-vertex graph with no 4-cycle. Answer: ex(n; C₄) ~ (1/2)n^{3/2}.

title: Erdős Problem #766: Extremal Numbers and Graph Density
description: Let f(n;k,l) = min ex(n;G) over graphs G with k vertices and l edges. Estimate f(n;k,l) for k < l ≤ k²/4. Is f strictly monotone in l? OPEN. Dirac-Erdős: f(n;k,⌊k²/4⌋+1) ≤ ⌊n²/4⌋+1.

title: Erdős Problem #767: Cycles with Chords
description: g_k(n) = max edges avoiding cycles with k chords incident to a vertex. Proved: g_k(n) = (k+1)n - (k+1)² for n ≥ 3k+3 (Jiang 2004). Status: SOLVED.

title: Erdős Problem #768: Integers with Witness Divisors
description: Determine the exact asymptotic density of integers n where every prime divisor p has a witness divisor d > 1 with d ≡ 1 (mod p).

title: Erdős Problem #769: Cube Dissection into Homothetic Cubes
description: Let c(n) be minimal such that for k ≥ c(n), the n-dimensional unit cube can be decomposed into k homothetic cubes. Is c(n) ≫ n^n? OPEN: Lower bound 2^{n+1}-1, upper bound O(n^{n+1}).

title: Erdos Problem #77: Ramsey Number Growth Rate
description: Find lim R(k)^{1/k} where R(k) is the diagonal Ramsey number. OPEN - bounds: sqrt(2) <= liminf <= limsup <= 3.7993 (2024). Prize: $100 for existence, $10000 for non-existence.

title: Erdős Problem #771: Subsets Avoiding a Given Sum
description: Let f(n) be maximal such that for every m ≥ 1, there exists S ⊆ {1,...,n} with |S| = f(n) where no subset of S sums to m. Is f(n) = (1/2+o(1))n/log n? SOLVED: YES (Erdős-Graham lower, Alon-Freiman upper).

title: Erdős Problem #772: Sidon Sets in Bounded Convolution Sets
description: Let H_k(n) be the maximal size of a Sidon subset in sets A with |A|=n and bounded convolution. Is H_k(n)/√n → ∞? YES, proved by Alon-Erdős (1985) with optimal bound H_k(n) = Θ(n^{2/3}).

title: Erdős Problem #773: Sidon Subsets of Perfect Squares
description: What is the max size of a Sidon subset of {1², 2², ..., N²}? OPEN: Lower bound N^{2/3} (Lefmann-Thiele), upper bound N/(log N)^{1/4} (Alon-Erdős). Is it N^{1-o(1)}?

title: Erdős Problem #774: Dissociated and Proportionately Dissociated Sets
description: A set A ⊂ ℕ is dissociated if distinct finite subsets have different sums. It is proportionately dissociated if every finite subset contains a proportional-size dissociated subset. Is every proportionately dissociated set a finite union of dissociated sets? OPEN (conjectured NO).

title: Erdős Problem #775: Clique Sizes in 3-Uniform Hypergraphs
description: Is there a 3-uniform hypergraph on n vertices with at least n - O(1) different clique sizes? NO, disproved by Gao (2025).

title: Erdos Problem #777: Comparable Pairs in Families of Sets
description: Given a family F of subsets of {1,...,n}, how many comparable pairs can it have? Three questions about edge counts in the comparability graph were resolved by Alon, Frankl, and others.

title: Erdos Problem #778: Clique-Building Games on Complete Graphs
description: Alice and Bob alternate coloring edges of K_n (red/blue). Alice wins if her largest red clique exceeds any blue clique. Does Bob have a winning strategy for n >= 3? OPEN. Malekshahian-Spiro (2024) proved Bob wins with density >= 3/4.

title: Erdős Problem #779: Primorial Plus Prime
description: Given the primorial P = p₁·p₂·...·pₙ (product of first n primes), does there always exist a prime p with pₙ < p < P such that P + p is also prime? An open problem of Deaconescu verified for n ≤ 1000.

title: Erdős Problem #780: Chromatic Number of Kneser Hypergraphs
description: If n ≥ kr + (t-1)(k-1) and edges of the complete r-uniform hypergraph on n vertices are t-colored, some color class contains k pairwise disjoint edges. SOLVED by Alon-Frankl-Lovász (1986), generalizing Lovász's proof of Kneser's conjecture.

title: Erdős Problem #781: Descending Waves in 2-Colorings
description: Let f(k) be the minimal n such that any 2-coloring of {1,...,n} contains a monochromatic k-term descending wave. Is f(k) = k² - k + 1? DISPROVED: Alon-Spencer (1989) showed f(k) ≫ k³, so the conjecture is false.

title: Erdős Problem #782: Quasi-Progressions and Cubes in the Squares
description: Two questions about structure in perfect squares: (1) Do squares contain arbitrarily long quasi-progressions with uniform bound C? (2) Do squares contain arbitrarily large combinatorial cubes?

title: Erdős Problem #784: Sieving Sets with Bounded Reciprocal Sums
description: Given C > 0, does there exist c > 0 such that sets A with Σ 1/n ≤ C leave ≫ x/(log x)^c unsieved elements? Answer: YES for C ≤ 1, NO for C > 1.

title: Erdős Problem #785: Exact Additive Complements
description: For exact additive complements A, B with A(x)B(x) ~ x, does A(x)B(x) - x tend to infinity? YES, proved by Sárközy-Szemerédi (1994).

title: Erdős Problem #786: Multiplicative Cardinality Sets
description: For any ε > 0, is there a set A of density > 1-ε such that equal products from A must have equal numbers of factors? Selfridge achieved density 1/e - ε; whether arbitrarily high density is possible remains OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #787: Sum-Free Subsets (Erdős-Moser Problem)
description: Let g(n) be maximal such that every n-set A has a sum-avoiding subset B of size ≥ g(n). Current bounds: (log n)^(1+c) ≪ g(n) ≪ exp(√(log n)).

title: Erdős Problem #788: Sum-Free Subsets in Intervals
description: Estimate f(n) where f(n) is maximal s.t. for all B ⊂ (2n,4n), ∃ C ⊂ (n,2n) sum-free w.r.t. B with |C|+|B| ≥ f(n). Conjectured f(n) ≤ n^{1/2+o(1)}. Known: n^{1/2} ≪ f(n) ≪ (n log n)^{2/3}. OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #789: Sum-Length-Free Subsets
description: Estimate h(n) where h(n) is the max |B| such that equal sums in B have equal length. Known: (n log n)^{1/3} ≪ h(n) ≪ √n. Status: OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #79: Minimally Non-Ramsey-Size-Linear Graphs
description: A graph is 'Ramsey size linear' if R(G,H) grows linearly in the edges of H. Are there infinitely many graphs that fail this property minimally - not Ramsey size linear, but all subgraphs are? Wigderson (2024) proved yes, though only K₄ is explicitly known.

title: Erdős Problem #790: Maximum Sum-Free Subsequences
description: Let l(n) be the maximum size of a guaranteed sum-free subset of any n-element set. Known bounds: √(n log n / log log n) ≤ l(n) ≤ n / log n (CKS 1975). Main conjecture: l(n) ≥ n^{1-o(1)}. OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #791: Finite Additive 2-Bases
description: Let g(n) be the minimal size of a set A ⊆ {0,...,n} such that {0,...,n} ⊆ A+A. Is g(n) ~ 2√n? NO - disproved by Mrose (1979).

title: Erdős Problem #792: Sum-Free Subsets
description: Estimate f(n), the minimum size of the largest sum-free subset guaranteed in any n-element set of integers.

title: Erdős Problem #793: Primitive Sets Avoiding Product Divisibility
description: Let F(n) = max size of A ⊆ {1,...,n} where a ∤ bc for distinct a,b,c ∈ A. Is F(n) = π(n) + (C+o(1))·n^{2/3}·(log n)^{-2} for some constant C? Known: bounds with different constants c₁, c₂. OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #794: 3-Uniform Hypergraph Edge Density
description: Is it true that every 3-uniform hypergraph on 3n vertices with at least n³+1 edges contains K₄⁻? DISPROVED by Harris. Balogh noted the 5-7 condition is redundant. Frankl-Füredi showed density ≥ 2/7 needed.

title: Erdős Problem #795
description: Determine tight bounds for g(n), the maximum size of a subset of {1,...,n} with all subset products distinct.

title: Erdős Problem #796: Second-Order Terms for g_k(n)
description: For g_k(n) = max |A| with A ⊆ {1,...,n} having < k representations per integer, is g₃(n) = (log log n / log n)n + (c+o(1))n/(log n)² for some c? First-order known, second-order OPEN.

title: Erdős Problem #797
description:

Tags
More
